Read the writing task and look at this student's plan for the composition. Then click to listen to a radio interview. Which of the arguments did the student hear in the interview? Click on them.
Writing Task 2

p.g: B. Greater profits for the agriculture industry
C. GM crops could be grown in difficult environments such as semi-desert
D. Tampering with nature is nothing new in agriculture
E. GM crops last longer in storage
F. Farmers of GM crops are less dependent on environmentally harmful insecticides
G. Improved flavour and appearance of GM foods
H. Improved nutritional value of GM foods
A. GM crops interfere with nature
B. Farming in previously uncultivated areas such as semi- desert may damage natural balance of nature
C. Non-GM farmers will go out of business
D. Traditional farming methods will disappear
E. GM crops may cause ecological damage (e.g. kill harmless insects)
F. Taste and appearance of GM foods is unnatural
G. GM foods may be bad for our health

section.p: If you find it difficult to think of ideas for Writing Task 2, remember that the topics you are asked to write about are often current issues and that these may be discussed in the press and on radio and television. It is good preparation, therefore, to spend time reading newspaper and magazine articles, listening to radio programmes and watching television programmes that deal with these kinds of topics as this will help you develop ideas on a wide variety of subjects.
